intro: Iguanura tenuis, commonly known as the slender iguana plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pale yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Iguanura tenuis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
